title: Energy giants bid to make Scotland first on wind power
lead: Shell and Scottish Power are among bidders to develop the next generation of wind farms off the Scottish coast.

title: Windfall: offshore power draws big players
lead: Douglas Fraser explains why firms with deep pockets are eager to unlock Scotland's offshore wind energy potential.

title: Rathlin to use wind and waves in green energy bid
lead: Residents of Rathlin Island are aiming to be carbon neutral by the end of the decade.

title: Green light for largest net zero housing project
lead: It is part of the £1.3bn Granton Waterfront Regeneration where more than 3,500 homes will be built in Edinburgh.

title: Villagers create green alternative to oil heating
lead: More than 100 boreholes will be dug in a field to provide natural heating to residents.

title: Read more about these links.
lead: George McGavin and Zoe Laughlin investigate the revolutionary science finding vital renewable resources and undiscovered life in sewage.

title: The massive green power projects stuck in limbo
lead: Developers argue that pumped storage hydro can help meet climate change targets, but no new schemes have been built for decades.

title: Airport to build solar farm next to runway
lead: Edinburgh Airport says the solar panels will provide 26% of its energy needs from next year.

title: 'Put politics aside' for Wales' Covid recovery
lead: One charity manager says it would be "wondrous" if Cardiff Bay and Westminster worked together.

title: Aberdeen zone funds to help green energy transition
lead: The Scottish government provides £26m for the Aberdeen Energy Transition Zone to aid the move away from oil and gas.

title: Greenhouse gas emissions target missed again
lead: Scottish government figures for 2019 show emissions fell 51.5% against the baseline, well short of the 55% target.

title: No progress on carbon neutrality, say councillors
lead: "I can't think of many things we've actually achieved," says one councillor.

title: Halogen lightbulb sales to be banned in UK
lead: September's ban will cut carbon emissions and save consumers money, the government says.

title: How cow poo is powering crypto mining
lead: One company is trying to persuade small-scale renewable generators to mine crypto currency.

title: New biogas plant to start producing energy in 2022
lead: The green energy facility will be built in Somerset after investors backed the project, which had stalled.

title: Bus depot to be 'UK's largest vehicle charging hub'
lead: First Bus will install 160 charging points and replace half its fleet with electric buses at its depot in Glasgow.

title: How to protect birds and bats from wind turbines
lead: As wind farm numbers explode researchers are coming up with more ways to keep wildlife safe.

title: Major project aims to clear clean energy hurdle
lead: A major project aims to overcome a barrier to electricity grids wholly supplied by renewable energy.

title: Oil giant Total rebrands in shift to renewables
lead: Total is the latest energy giant to face pressure from shareholders to reduce carbon emissions faster.

title: UK experiment could sweep aside fusion hurdle
lead: Results from a UK experiment could help clear a hurdle to achieving commercial fusion power.
